message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CC 

The paper deals with the connection between index coding and matroid theory, which is a topic that falls under information theory (cs.IT) and networked systems (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the concept of differential error correcting index codes, which is related to coding theory (cs.IT) and communication complexity (cs.CC). The use of discrete polymatroids is a key aspect of the paper, which is a topic in combinatorial optimization (cs.DS) and possibly also in social and information networks (cs.SI).
